features: HYDRAULIC RESISTANCE: Cycle between 12 levels of hydraulic resistance with a turn of a knob on the squat assist machine. Each level makes it progressively harder to flex and lower your hips.

ASSISTED SQUAT MOTION: This rowing machine supports you as you perform a controlled squat motion (14.37 inches) against hydraulic resistance. This movement targets muscles in your lower body and shoulders as you perform controlled squats.

OPTIMAL STABILITY: Increase your stability with the wide pivoting pedals, two-way adjustable seat, and two-way adjustable handle bars with anti-slip grip. Take advantage of the end cap levelers keep machine grounded on a variety of home surfaces.
PERFORMANCE DISPLAY: Keep track of vital workout information during your exercise session. Track total time, squat count, and calories burned.
STURDY DESIGN: This squat assist machine is made out of heavy-duty metal can support a maximum user weight of 220lbs.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: DIGITAL MONITOR Keep track of vital workout information during your exercise session. Track total time, squat count, and calories burned in the digital monitor screen. HYDRAULIC RESISTANCE Cycle between 12 levels of hydraulic resistance with a turn of a knob on the squat assist machine. Each level makes it progressively harder to flex and lower your hips. ADJUSTABLE HANDLEBARS Two-way adjustable seat, and two-way adjustable handlebars with anti-slip grip add extra comfort and security while in use. SELF LEVELING FOOT PEDALS Increase your stability with the wide pivoting pedals. Self leveling pedals make getting on and off your machine easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great exercise machine. It really works you out my 84-year-old mother loves to come to my house to use it. She says it helps with her hip pain so I surprised her at Christmas with one. highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does the trick!
reviews.reviewText: Looks good, easy assembly. Good workout. Definately made for small to mid size person. Not the sturdiest

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I Love it!
reviews.reviewText: I am 61 have had 5 knee surgeries and was unsure about getting this. I am very glad I did. With the weather being too hot and humid to walk I needed something. I use it twice a day. You can adjust the tension from 1 to 20. I am still on 1 but have increased from 10 times to 30. I feel it in my legs and shoulders. I also bought it to do squats. Not sure if has helped in that area yet but I do feel better. My Husband even uses it. It is not cheaply made and it us sturdy. We have it on carpet. Nice buy for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not what I expected for the money
reviews.reviewText: Be sure you understand this is a total body workout... This is a little unstable on carpet. I am 72 years old and find this a good workout, but it is very low to the ground when you try to get started. Just watch the video and I do not recommend it for a normal older person unless in good shape and driven. The mechanics of this machine are good but again for the money I would have expected it to be a lot sturdier. Keeping it but had I seen it I would have moved on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: All the parts were there. Easy to assemble. Received by time stated. Started using it the next day. Glad I bought it. It is worth the money. Thanks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap materials used and wobbly
reviews.reviewText: This bike is very flimsy and not sturdy even when it’s properly put together. The pedometer is plastic and inaccurate at best. I was hoping it would be somewhat compatible to the DB Method squat machine but no comparison. I should have spent the extra $ for that because shipping eats up the refund amount.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Intense exercise experience
reviews.reviewText: Having had the machine for a few weeks I have a few thoughts about the machine. 1) This has an extreme range of motion. 2) It focuses intently on the front of the thighs and the calves. 3) I am in terrible shape.I found that if you get on the machine by first sitting on the machines seat, you will go through a huge range of motion. From the seated position, this is similar to squatting to the point your hammies area touching your calves. My 65 year old knees object to this much range of motion. My solution: I step on the peddles from the standing position while holding the handle bar. I then lower my self to just above the point my knees object. Then I return to the top position.The first time I used the machine, I only could handle about 1 minute of work. I have broken my exercise into smaller sets and have increased my exercise time with each set.I like this machine, it sets my thighs on fire and I would recommend it to anyone at long as you find a range of motion that works for you and doesn't cause you strain.Worth a look!
